alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 19 at 2:45AM PST until November 19 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow showers above 4000 feet expected. An additional 2 to 4 inches are expected this morning, leading to a storm total snow accumulation of 8 to 12 inches. * WHERE...The Southern Oregon Cascades from Lake of the Woods Pass on Highway 140 northward. This includes Crater Lake and Diamond Lake as well as Highway 58 at Willamette Pass, Highway 62, and Highway 138. * WHEN...Through 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Snow and breezy winds will lower visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will lessen Sunday morning. Overnight lows on Sunday night are expected to be in the low 20s, and flash freezing may be possible on wet roads. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
